description.narrative: Albanian society upholds democratic values allowing citizens equal opportunities to make informed choices and hold public institutions accountable.

Den föreslagna insatsen innebär ett stöd till BIRN Albania för implementering av deras halvtidsstrategi för 2018-2020. BIRN Albaniens huvuduppdrag är att upprätthålla demokratiska värderingar, vilket tillåter albanska medborgare att erhålla lika möjligheter till medvetna val och lika möjligheter att ställa regeringen till svars.

The contribution is core support to BIRN Albania for implementing the mid-term strategy 2018-2020. The main objective of BIRN's work in Albania is "Albanian society uphold democratic values allowing citiznes equal opportunities to make informed choices and hold the goverment accountable".

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

description.narrative: During 2018, BIRN Albania has prioritised the monitoring of the justice reform but this has not impeded the implementation of the planned activities in line with the three strategic direction of the organisation. BIRN Albania has produced a considerable number of investigative stories, news pieces and articles. The impact of the investigative stories has been significant. Below are presented selected results from the work during 2019 and also quantitaive data from the annual report. - The investigation published in November 12th, by BIRN Albania editor Besar Likmeta “Një biznes familjar: Farmacitë e lidhura me drejtuesit e Fondit përfituan miliona euro nga ilaçet” (A family Affair; Pharmacies Linked with Fund Employees Rank Millions). The investigation produced after a six months research reveals how a handful of pharmacies owned by the family members of the employees of the Health Insurance Fund, which have been investigated for fraud, ranked tens of millions of euros in drug reimbursements from 2010 to 2018, despite worries over conflicts of interests and illegal gains. In January 2019, the Tirana Prosecutor’s Office issued arrest warrants for two of the pharmacists who benefited from the fraudulent practices, underlining the role played by the BIRN investigation in the case.- A BIRN Albania data driven deep dive investigation published on June 26th on how the public utility company OSHEE, has inflated costs and doubled its in order to keep the price of electricity high, while the public watchdog, the Energy Regulatory Agency, ERE, has turned a blind eye - 5 formal trainings were org ionised for journalists. In order to increase the capacities of local journalists in investigative and specialized reporting, BIRN Albania has provided continuous on-the-job training and mentoring for 20 local journalists awarded with reporting grants for covering cases of corruption and lack of transparency in several fields. T - In order to promote the decade-long grassroots struggle of local communities, activists and civil society organisations against hydro power plant projects that threaten the environment, the water supplies of local communities and their livelihoods that are based on sustainable tourism, BIRN Albania has produced a 45 minutes long documentary. “Free Flow" chronicles the efforts of local communities, environmental organisations and activists in Albania to halt the destruction of the precious Valbona and Vjosa rivers, protected areas now under threat by the Albanian government attempting to build numerous hydro power plants. This timely documentary presents a resistance movement led by local residents and environmental activists who are standing up against the devastating wave of hydro power plants in Albania over the last decade. -During 2018, BIRN Albania has continuously covered protests of different marginalized groups, with a special focus on the activists protesting against the demolishing of National Theatre to make space for real estate development; the students’ protests over the university reform; and the protests of communities at risk of eviction due to the construction of the ring road in Tirana. The continues coverage of such protests and grass roots resistance efforts, as well as specific in-depth stories on under-reported groups (such as Intersex community, chronic patients and refugees) has helped amplify their voices and bring them to the mainstream. BIRN Albania’s objective and fact-based coverage has also helped inform public debate on these issues, leading to a more informed citizenry. - Also, during 2018, BIRN Albania was actively involved in lobbying against two government sponsored initiatives which posed a serious threat to media freedom in the country. The first attack against the independent media was undertaken by AKEP (Electronic and Postal Communications Authority), which in October 2018 issued a public ‘black’ list of 44 websites - including BIRN Albania’s Reporter.al outlet – giving a 72-hour deadline to register with tax officials or be shut down. BIRN reacted immediately to this initiative by several articles and contacts with AKEP, different partners and human rights organizations. Few days later, OSCE and CRD condemned the initiative, which was stopped due to lack of regulatory framework in support of such procedures. The second initiative considered concerning in regards to media freedom in the country was initiated by the office of Albania’s Prime Minister which proposed changes in two laws foreseeing the registration of online media and the policing of news content for a variety of reasons, including “biased” news, news that “damages public morals” and “publications that can incite penal offences”. Failure to uphold the law would result in fines of up to 8,000 euros and even closure of websites.BIRN Albania representatives were part of the three public consultation meetings organized by the authorities, as well as reporting over the threats that such changes pose not only to media freedom, but to freedom of expression in general, as long as the new regulation is attempting to regulate every online website, including blogs and pages of non-governmental and educational institutions. Quantitative data, 2018: 53 investigations published at Reporter.al by BIRN Albania staff215 analysis/features/interviews published at Reporter.al717 news pieces published at Reporter.al by BIRN Albania staff189 photo rich and video stories published at Reporter.al by BIRN Albania staff617 articles translated form BI/Project Syndicate and published at Reporter.al9199 republications of articles produced for Reporter.al by BIRN Albania staff3147 republications of articles produced for BI and translated from BIRN Albania
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
